summary: Completed partial frontend testing of NexaClinq drug database and template filtering features. Login functionality works but authentication session persistence issues prevent complete testing of Settings page features.

authentication_issues.issue: Authentication session does not persist properly - app redirects to login page after navigation
authentication_issues.impact: Prevents testing of Settings page, DrugsManager, TemplatesManager, and prescription flow

untested_features.reason: Cannot access Settings page due to authentication issues

untested_features.feature: Search functionality for 'Doxiciclina' in vet mode
untested_features.reason: Cannot access DrugsManager due to authentication issues

untested_features.feature: Search functionality for 'Losartana' in human mode
untested_features.reason: Cannot access DrugsManager and practice switching due to authentication issues
Cannot access Settings page due to authentication issues
Cannot navigate to prescription flow due to authentication issues

passed_tests: Seed upgrade logs appear in console (NexaClinq: Upgrading Drug Database, Templates)
No RxDB errors in console (only expected premium plugin message)
Practice switcher (VET/MD) is visible and functional
Sidebar navigation elements are present (Pacientes, Banco de Medicamentos, etc.)
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix authentication session persistence issue. The Firebase authentication works for initial login but sessions don't persist during navigation, causing redirects to login page. This blocks testing of all Settings page features including DrugsManager, TemplatesManager, and prescription flow. Investigate AuthContext, LicenseContext, and Firebase configuration for session management issues.
